thread.title: Former US solider charged with plotting 'ISIS-inspired' attack to kill 'innocent victims'
thread.title_full: Former US solider charged with plotting 'ISIS-inspired' attack to kill 'innocent victims'

title: Former US solider charged with plotting 'ISIS-inspired' attack to kill 'innocent victims'
text:
Former US solider charged with plotting 'ISIS-inspired' attack to kill 'innocent victims' Former US solider charged with plotting 'ISIS-inspired' attack to kill 'innocent victims' A FORMER US soldier has been charged with attempting to help would-be jihadis plot an ISIS-inspired attack. PUBLISHED: 02:  | UPDATED: 03:12, Wed, Feb 22, 2017 BOONE COUNTY MO SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT Robert Lorenzo Hester Jr was caught by FBI agents 
Robert Lorenzo Hester Jr was caught as part of a covert FBI operation who developed a fake plan to target Kansas City, according to criminal complaints. 
Missouri-born Hester allegedly told undercover officials he was “down” with the plan to hit the city. Related articles 'ISIS supporting' teenager & 2 men charged for plotting terror attack 
US Attorney Tammy Dickinson said: "First on social media, then during face-to-face meetings with an undercover FBI employee, this defendant repeatedly expressed his intent to engage in acts of violent jihad against the United States.” 
She added that the 25-year-old soldier, who was discharged in 2013 after less than a year, “believed he was part of an ISIS-sponsored terrorist attack that would result in the deaths and injuries of many innocent victims”. 
An undercover agent told Hester his terror cell was plotting to kill “a lot of people “ in an attack “10 times more” severe than the Boston Marathon attack. 
Hester rejected the agent’s offer to walk away from the plans. 
FBI officials targeted Hester after being tipped off about his social media posts where he expressed his support for radical Islam and violence. GETTY Kansas City was the alleged target 
Hester wrote messages to undercover FBI agents – who he believed were terrorist sympathisers – stating the US Government should be “overthrown” and that he wanted “global jihad”. 
The officers told Hester to buy a list of items – including duct tape, copper wire and roofing nails – to “bring some kind of destruction”. 
Hester allegedly replied: “I'm just ready to help. I'm ready to help any way I can.” Bodies of 87 migrants have washed ashore in the Libyan city of Zawiya Tue, February 21, 2017 The bodies of 74 drowned African migrants have washed ashore in Libya, leading to speculation people traffickers removed the motor from their boat during the treacherous Mediterranean crossing.
